datastore

Class DatalutionDatastoreService

  • java.lang.Object
    • datastore.DatalutionDatastoreService

  • public class DatalutionDatastoreService
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides the methods to interact with Google Datastore. It can be used similar to the DatastoreService with core methods put(Entity entity) and get(Key key).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatalutionDatastoreService() 
      DatalutionDatastoreService(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.DatastoreService ds) 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewEntity(java.lang.String kind)
      This method adds a new entity kind to Datastore with default attribute "id"
      void addStartEntities()
      This method adds start/test entities to Datastore.
      com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity get(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key key)
      Get an entity from Datastore with current kind and id (lazy migration with Datalog will be started if necessary)
      com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity getLatestEntity(java.lang.String kind, int id)
      Returns the latest entitiy saved in Datastore for specific kind and id
      Schema getLatestSchema(java.lang.String kind)
      Returns the latest schema of a specific kind
      int getLatestSchemaVersion(java.lang.String kind)
      Returns the highest schema version for specific kind
      Schema getSchema(java.lang.String kind, int version)
      Gets specific schema with current kind and version
      com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key put(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity entity)
      This method executes an manual put to Datastore Each manual put will be executed in an individual transaction.
      void putToDatabase(java.lang.String datalogFact)
      Write a datalog fact to Datastore; timestamp will be added automatically; used for generated entities in lazy migration
      void saveCurrentSchema(java.lang.String kind, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> newAttributesList)
      Write a schema to Datastore;
      java.lang.String saveSchemaChange(java.lang.String command)
      Generates rules and adds them to Datastore if a schema change occurs (add, delete, copy, move)

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key put(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity entity)
        This method executes an manual put to Datastore Each manual put will be executed in an individual transaction.
        Parameters:
        entity - Entity object to put to Datastore
        Returns:
        key

      • get

        public com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Entity get(com.google.appengine.api.datastore.Key key)
                                              throws com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        Get an entity from Datastore with current kind and id (lazy migration with Datalog will be started if necessary)
        Parameters:
        key - Key of needed entity (e.g. Player)
        Returns:
        latest entity (even after lazy migration)
        Throws:
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

      • saveSchemaChange

        public java.lang.String saveSchemaChange(java.lang.String command)
                                  throws java.util.InputMismatchException,
                                         ParseException,
                                         java.io.IOException,
                                         ParseException,
                                         com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        Generates rules and adds them to Datastore if a schema change occurs (add, delete, copy, move)
        Parameters:
        command - Command which triggers a schema change
        Returns:
        generated Datalog rules saved in Datastore
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException
        ParseException
        java.io.IOException
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

        Parameters:
        kind - of entity (e.g. Player)
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • putToDatabase

        public void putToDatabase(java.lang.String datalogFact)
                   throws java.util.InputMismatchException,
                          ParseException,
                          com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        Write a datalog fact to Datastore; timestamp will be added automatically; used for generated entities in lazy migration
        Parameters:
        datalogFact - e.g. "Player2(4,'Lisa',40)"
        Throws:
        java.util.InputMismatchException
        ParseException
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

      • saveCurrentSchema

        public void saveCurrentSchema(java.lang.String kind,
                     java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> newAttributesList)
        Write a schema to Datastore;
        Parameters:
        kind - of entity (e.g. Player)
        newAttributesList - list of attribute names (with prefix "?")
        Throws:
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException

      • addNewEntity

        public void addNewEntity(java.lang.String kind)
                  throws com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException,
                         java.util.InputMismatchException
        This method adds a new entity kind to Datastore with default attribute "id"
        Parameters:
        kind - New entity type
        Throws:
        com.google.appengine.api.datastore.EntityNotFoundException
        java.util.InputMismatchException

      • addStartEntities

        public void addStartEntities()
        This method adds start/test entities to Datastore. Only for test cases - three Player and three Mission entities will be added.
